title: (x) decorative sans with identical loop on "l" and "y" - Suburban {Tiff}
content:
hi everyone. I’ve been looking for this font for a while. It is fairly distinctive so I’m hoping someone will know what it is. it’s the font on the [following card](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122055636/http:/twopiglets.com/letterpress.php?product_id=206). the l and the y appear to be the same shape.

thanks.

 [‹ (x) Apple Berry Pie casual sans - Teen {Dennis}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122055636/http:/typophile.com/node/19390 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Los Cucos Mexican Cafe logo - (similar to) Hobo {Claes} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122055636/http:/typophile.com/node/19389 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Ou Est

comments.content: This is in fact the only typeface (in the world) where ’l’ and ’y’ share the same shape.
